intro: Cuphea glauca f. strigosa, commonly known as the silverleaf cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage and clusters of tubular, pink to red flowers. The plant belongs to the Lythraceae family and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for drought-tolerant landscaping. Its unique appearance and ease of cultivation contribute to its popularity among horticulturists and gardeners.
